title: Whenever we meet someone we used to say ‘Hi’ or ‘Hello’. What can we say instead of those? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t get if you mean meeting someone for the first time or meeting a friend therefore I will answer both the sides. Instead of immediately saying “hi” or “hello”, present yourself. “My name is _____, and you are?” Remember to smile when you say this to look friendly if not they will think you are just a creepy stalker guy. If you are meeting a friend, you could say his name. Let’s say I see my friend Lucy in the park, I’ll go “Lucy!!!”. If you need more, by searching on the thesaurus, some synonyms of hello are greetings, howdy, bonjour, what’s up, hey… There are a lot of them. You can just pick. :)

If you are meeting someone for the first time, I suggest you stick with formality and introduce yourself with a polite 'hello!' but if you are already acquainted with the person you can directly go with 'hey!' or 'sup!' or 'yo!' or something of your convenience
